diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: History of Prostate Cancer, previously treated with Radical Prostatectomy (2020), Salvage Pelvic RT (2022), and ongoing ADT.
diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Severe low back pain (8/10), localized to L3 region, worse with movement.

treatmentPlan.intent: Palliative (Pain control, prevention of fracture/cord compression)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing L3 vertebral body + small margin (PTV_L3).
medications: Anti-emetics PRN (low risk with spine RT)

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine with knee sponge and ankle immobilization for comfort and stability. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.immobilization: VacLok bag, knee sponge, ankle immobilization.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.ctNotes: Non-contrast CT acquired supine. Scan range includes L1-L5. Fused with diagnostic MRI for target delineation.

fractions.setupNotes: kV pair imaging for daily setup. Matched to L3 vertebral body.
fractions.sideEffects: Slight improvement in back pain (6/10). No acute side effects.

fractions.notes: Completed palliative RT course. To follow up with Med Onc.

imagingAndReports.summary: Multiple areas of increased uptake consistent with widespread bone metastases, including lumbar spine, ribs, pelvis. Most intense uptake at L3.

imagingAndReports.type: MRI Lumbar Spine w/ & w/o Contrast
imagingAndReports.summary: Large enhancing lesion replacing majority of L3 vertebral body, mild posterior bulging without frank cord compression. Correlates with area of maximal pain.
Non-contrast CT acquired supine. Scan includes L1-L5. Fused with diagnostic MRI.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Samuel Adams (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt with mCRPC on ADT presents with worsening LBP (8/10). Pain localized to L-spine. Recent PSA rising, bone scan showed extensive mets. Order urgent MRI L-spine to assess L3 met, rule out cord compression. Start scheduled Oxycodone. Refer to Rad Onc for palliative RT consult.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Laura Fisher (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ mCRPC referred for palliative RT to painful L3 metastasis. MRI reviewed, shows large L3 lesion without cord compression. Discussed palliative RT options (30/10 vs 20/5 vs 8/1). Plan for 30Gy/10fx via 3D-CRT AP/PA fields. Explained goals (pain relief), procedure, low risk side effects (mild fatigue, transient pain flare, low nausea risk). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Laura Fisher (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 5/10 fx. Reports slight improvement in back pain (6/10). No acute side effects noted. Tolerating RT well. Continue current plan.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Laura Fisher (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Completed 10/10 fx palliative RT to L3 spine. Pain significantly improved (3/10). Continue pain meds as needed, discuss taper w/ Med Onc. Follow up with Med Onc regarding systemic therapy options. Rad Onc F/U PRN.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Palliative treatment to relieve pain in the lower back, improve mobility, and prevent a potential fracture or spinal cord compression.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Potential for a temporary 'pain flare' where pain might briefly worsen before improving. Mild fatigue. Low risk of nausea or skin reaction with this technique.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Report any new or worsening weakness, numbness, or loss of bowel/bladder control immediately.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, report pain levels and any new symptoms.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Continue pain medication as prescribed and discuss tapering with primary oncology team as pain improves.
